page.title: 12Old People in Wootton
page.content: We interviewed a retired district nurse who now does a great deal for old people. An Old Folks' Club meets once a fortnight. On Wednesday there is a whist afternoon in the Old Folks' room and a social afternoon on Thursdays. Twice a week there is a luncheon club for 25 to 30 people. Two courses and coffee are served for 60p. About twelve people in the village receive{meals-on-wheels.}These are cooked in Marcham Primary School and delivered by volunteer drivers. A team of volunteer drivers also take old people to hospital appointments. A special church service is held once a month in the Old Folks' room for people who do not want to come to church. A {mobile library}calls fort- nightly. The British Legion also cares for the old people. They give a Â£5 voucher to the old and visit them.
